title: LAN Chile old logo
content:
Hello everyone! I’ve been banging my head to the wall trying to identify font on LAN Chile (airline) old logo. I need it for my project and would appreciate your help :)

Sorry for the small pictures, but I hope they are clear enough.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lan1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/typophile.com/files/lan1.jpg) | 13.93 KB |
| [lan2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/typophile.com/files/lan2.jpg) | 16.1 KB |

 [‹ US Cellular Typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/typophile.com/node/50504 "Go to previous forum topic") [Swedish magazine typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/typophile.com/node/50484 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jorot

comments.content: This was most likely hand lettered. Your best bets may be [Charter Oak](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/charter_oak_normal_ot_std_urw/), [Serpentine Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/serpentine_bold_oblique/), or [FF Trademarker](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142659/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_trademarker_ot_fat_italic/).
Thanks Stephen! I think FF TradeMarker is pretty close match and modifying it a little I can use it.
